Content:: The Tour du Loir-et-Cher is a cycling stage race that takes place in the Loir-et-Cher region of France. The race traditionally starts and finishes in the capital of Blois. Since at least 2009, the final stage has consisted of a 12-lap circuit race totaling 97.5 km.[1] It is rated as a 2.2 race as part of the UCI Europe Tour.[2] The race first took place in 1960. This cycling race article related to French cycling is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
